comment.author: 34846864@N06
comment._content: Amy Johnson was such a celebrated aviator that songs were written about her. Billy Maloney, who was a well known vaudeville performer and composer in the 1920s wrote a song called "Take off your hats to Amy Johnson". You can see this music score online at the National Library of Australia. See the whole music score

comment.author: 53133240@N00
comment._content: Many real photo postcards of Amy Johnson were published. One set was sponsored by the magazine "Tit-bits," which today seems pretty funny. I have a picture of one of their cards here.

comment.author: 11519144@N05
comment._content: My Grandfather was the man who drove out to her crashed plane when she landed in Brisbane at Eagle Farm Aerodrome. I have a documented original photograph of Amy Johnson on the raised stand with flowers with my Grandfather standing in the open car in front of the stand. The photo is embossed from the photographer "F. W. Thiel Brisbane".

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: detcatguy, thanks for sharing your story and what a great photograph to have in your possession!
